description: The Leamington Arts Centre is a not-for-profit community arts organization. Founded in 1971, the Leamington Arts Centre is a hub for artistic expression and community engagement.
It offers exhibitions that showcase local, regional, and national artists. The centre aims to promote the arts in the Leamington area and provide a space for creativity.

This building was built to be a Post Office in 1911. It was replaced in 1959 by the new Post Office at John Street and Queen's Avenue. After that, the building was used by Canada Customs until its purchase by the Town.
Open Tuesday to Saturday from 11 AM to 5 PM.
Photo by Chris Woodrich via Wikimedia Commons, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0.
